text: You don't get a bet ref until after the delay (so you can't cancel until then). It's worth being clear on how this works. As <@UBS7QANF3> and others have made clear place and instant cancel is the best way to do FOK in any scenario.

text: If there's value at available prices why not just execute at 0EV or whatever minimal margin is acceptable to you and let BPE take care of it for you so that you get as much as possible at +EV? If there's not then you're offering so your bet will need some time in the market. Why would you want to meet an average price? Imagine that as two separate bets - you've got one at +EV (great) so now you're going to place one at -EV? Why? You want less money? Nuts.

text: I take a small fraction of +EV bets. And that small fraction, with lots of requests not matching, is carefully scaled to around $3M/month at the moment, because that is all the risk I want to take right now

text: In tennis, one single match decided in a tiebreaker could cost me 10 times more than the extra I would make by running a request and cancel over an entire year. It would make no sense to chase pennies when other areas of investigation could yield at least 100 times that difference

text: It's a bit of a surprise to me that people are so concerned about their transaction count. Personally I've never paid a penny in transaction fees because comm always covers it. To get caught for charges you've either got to be matching very low margins or posting a lot of orders with little prospect of matching. Either way it suggests that your management of margin could be improved. I know <@U01B8031PM1> sometimes pays quite a bit but my guess is that he'll push his margin or his matching rates up over time and the fees will dwindle. 0 margin or unmatched bets don't make any profit and after all so a smart player will learn to omit them and transaction fees become irrelevant.

text: The code should give a good overview of whats what <https://github.com/liampauling/flumine/blob/master/flumine/controls/loggingcontrols.py>

attachments.text:
```
import logging
import queue
from threading import Thread

from ..events import events
from ..events.events import EventType

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)


class LoggingControl(Thread):
    """
    Base Logging Control instance, used to output logging of
    trades, orders, new markets and market closure. Can be
    used to send data to a database or API for further analysis.
    """

    NAME = "LOGGING_CONTROL"

    def __init__(self, daemon: bool = True):
        Thread.__init__(self, daemon=daemon, name=self.NAME)
        self.logging_queue = queue.Queue()
        self.cache = []

    def run(self) -> None:
        <http://logger.info|logger.info>("Starting logging control %s" % self.NAME)
        while True:
            event = self.logging_queue.get()
            if event is None:
                <http://logger.info|logger.info>("Shutting down logging control %s" % self.NAME)
                break
            else:
                try:
                    self.process_event(event)
                except Exception as e:
                    logger.critical(
                        "{0} exception raised in {0}".format(e, self.NAME),
                        exc_info=True,
                        extra={"event": event},
                    )

    def process_event(self, event: events.BaseEvent):
        if event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.CONFIG:
            self._process_config(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.STRATEGY:
            self._process_strategy(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.MARKET:
            self._process_market(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.TRADE:
            self._process_trade(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.ORDER:
            self._process_order(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.BALANCE:
            self._process_balance(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.CLEARED_ORDERS:
            self._process_cleared_orders(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.CLEARED_ORDERS_META:
            self._process_cleared_orders_meta(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.CLEARED_MARKETS:
            self._process_cleared_markets(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.CLOSE_MARKET:
            self._process_closed_market(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.CUSTOM_EVENT:
            self._process_custom_event(event)

        elif event.EVENT_TYPE == EventType.TERMINATOR:
            self._process_end_flumine(event)
            self.logging_queue.put(None)

        else:
            logger.error("Unwanted item in logging control: {0}".format(event))

    def _process_config(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: config.py file
        """
        logger.debug("process_config: %s" % event)

    def _process_strategy(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Strategy class
        """
        logger.debug("process_strategy: %s" % event)

    def _process_market(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Market class
        """
        logger.debug("process_market: %s" % event)

    def _process_trade(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Trade class
        """
        logger.debug("process_trade: %s" % event)

    def _process_order(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Order class
        """
        logger.debug("process_order: %s" % event)

    def _process_balance(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Client class
        """
        logger.debug("process_balance: %s" % event)

    def _process_cleared_orders(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: betfairlightweight resources.ClearedOrders
        """
        logger.debug("process_cleared_orders: %s" % event)

    def _process_cleared_orders_meta(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: list of orders
        """
        logger.debug("process_cleared_orders_meta: %s" % event)

    def _process_cleared_markets(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: betfairlightweight resources.ClearedOrders
        """
        logger.debug("process_cleared_markets: %s" % event)

    def _process_closed_market(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Market class
        """
        logger.debug("process_closed_market: %s" % event)

    def _process_custom_event(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Custom event
        """
        logger.debug("process_custom_event: %s" % event)

    def _process_end_flumine(self, event):
        """
        :param event.event: Termination Event
        """
        logger.debug("_process_end_flumine: %s" % event)

```

text: @*Pierino Schiavone BFLW can be used to access the undocumented Betfair scores API only, but I suspect the consensus here would be that that service isn't very accurate and you'd be better off running a separate process to ingest this sort of data from a more reliable source, caching it locally (e.g. with Redis or similar) and then reading it as needed for your BFLW/Flumine strategies.*

elements.text: Pierino Schiavone BFLW can be used to access the undocumented Betfair scores API only, but I suspect the consensus here would be that that service isn't very accurate and you'd be better off running a separate process to ingest this sort of data from a more reliable source, caching it locally (e.g. with Redis or similar) and then reading it as needed for your BFLW/Flumine strategies.
